docs.lead_paragraph: Senator John Edwards, a Democratic presidential contender, wants to require parents to have health insurance for their children, making medical care an American birthright much like education. Mr. Edwards, of North Carolina, wants $25 billion annually in tax credits to help parents pay the cost of enrolling their children in private or government plans.

headline.main: Candidate Proposes Requiring Health Insurance for Children

docs.abstract: Democratic presidential contender Sen John Edwards says nation's 12 million uninsured children should be first priority in overhauling health care system; proposes annual $25 billion in tax credits to help parents pay cost of obtaining health insurance for their children; photo (M)
